name: 6.20 "The Sam in the Gray Flannel Suit" Online Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Massachusetts Scientific Journal.

	Cliff said he had the magazine because "some guy on his route left town and didn't leave a forwarding address". He told Carla about a study using twins that offered $50 a piece.

questions.text: What were the names of Carla's twins?
questions.explanation:
Jesse and Elvis.

	Carla named her twins after Elvis Presley and his twin brother Jesse. Jesse Presley died at birth.

questions.text: What did Woody say was wrong with Rebecca?
questions.correct: She talked to herself a lot.
options: She had on too much make-up.
questions.explanation:
She talked to herself a lot.

	Rebecca was upset that Sam got a promotion and she didn't. She was talking to herself when she asked "What's wrong with me?" Woody answered, "For one thing Miss Howe, you talk to yourself an awful lot."

questions.text: Who came to see Sam at his new job?
questions.explanation:
Cliff, Norm and Woody.

	The guys surprised Sam by stopping in at his office. Sam wasn't really doing anything as he was not given anything to do. He was playing with his pencil sharpener.

questions.text: Why was Sam hired for his new job?
options: slept with one of the executives
no one else wanted the job
questions.explanation:
as a ringer.

	The corporation just made the playoffs in the softball tournament. Since Sam was a professional pitcher, they wanted him to play on the team so they would win. In order to play he had to work for the company. Apparently being a bartender was not good enough; he had to be an executive.

questions.text: Why did Sam apologize to Rebecca?
options: for taking the job she wanted
questions.explanation:
for teasing her.

	He told Rebecca that she could be a cheerleader if she took off her bra. Before that, he told her "I've always admired your pom-poms." When she came to see Sam at his office, he apologized for this.

questions.text: When Rebecca told Sam the truth about his job, did Sam believe her?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Sam thought that Rebecca was making it up because she was jealous. Rebecca wanted to tell him the news to get back at him, but then she felt sorry for him and had to tell him the news anyway.

questions.text: Complete this line spoken by Sam: "I thought you wanted me for my mind and it turns out you wanted me for my ______"... what?
questions.explanation:
body.

	He then said, "Where have I heard that before?" Sam was offended that they only wanted him as an executive so they could win the softball championship game.

questions.text: What did Sam do to try to have sex with Rebecca?
questions.explanation:
play on her sympathy.

	When Sam found out he was just a ringer, he was upset. By the time he got back to the bar, he felt better but Rebecca showed him compassion and soon he was hitting on her.

questions.text: Did Sam have sex with Rebecca in this episode?
questions.explanation:
No.

	She told Sam to go ahead because she was sick of him hitting on her. She wasn't planning to be actively involved however, so he refused to have sex with her.
